result.execSummary:
The defendant Niego L Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

Defendant sentenced to serve 100 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 50 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is to be used at 
          the discretion of the agent.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  
     *   Pay all mandatory costs by 11/30/2016. 
          Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at  
          the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Successfully complete 50 hours of community
          service.
     *   No firearms; weapons

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for decision, held. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED defense counsel's motion.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program report dated November 3, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for decision. COURT IS DOWN for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for decision in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. COURT RETAINED COURT FILE.  Decision scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
-State's Brief In Opposition To Defense Motion To Suppress Evidence from Assistant District Attorney Randy Sitzberger; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program report dated October 23, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Defense Memorandum Of Law And Analysis from Attorney Michael Jude on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Michael Jude in the Court requesting extension to provide necessary documents to the Court. Per Assistant District Attorney Randy Sitzberger does not object, Per Assistant District Attorney Kelly O'Neil.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
-CASE CALLED AT 2:26 P.M. In court discussion put on the record. 
-SAME APPEARANCES/COURT REPORTER 

Motion hearing to suppress evidence proceeded.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer John Neuburg.  Exhibit # 1 offered and received from the state.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for decision.  Decision scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program violation dated October 9, 2015; received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-To Suppress Evidence from Attorney Michael Jude on behalf of his client; received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program report dated June 30, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel requests motion hearing. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by September 1, 2015.   State's response: September 21, 2015. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 6/2/15 received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Niego L Jackson in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Niego L Jackson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Niego L Jackson not in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
